questions.question: What is the primary purpose of cross-examination in Lincoln-Douglas debate?
choices: To clarify opponent's arguments and expose weaknesses
questions.answer: To clarify opponent's arguments and expose weaknesses

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an effective questioning technique in cross-examination?
choices: Using closed questions to pin down specific points
questions.answer: Using argumentative or hostile questioning

questions.question: What is a 'leading question' in the context of cross-examination?
choices: A question that prompts or encourages a desired answer
The first question asked in cross-examination
A question that leads to a new topic
questions.answer: A question that prompts or encourages a desired answer

questions.question: What is the recommended time for cross-examination in the lesson plan's practice activity?
questions.answer: 3 minutes

questions.question: Which of the following is an effective strategy for answering questions during cross-examination?
choices: Providing long, detailed answers to every question
Avoiding direct answers to difficult questions
questions.answer: Answering directly and concisely

questions.question: What is 'flowing' in the context of Lincoln-Douglas debate?
choices: Taking effective notes during a debate
questions.answer: Taking effective notes during a debate

questions.question: What is a 'concession' in debate terms?
choices: Admitting that a point made by the opponent is valid
questions.answer: Admitting that a point made by the opponent is valid

questions.question: Which activity is suggested in the lesson plan to practice cross-examination skills?
questions.answer: Cross-examination role play

questions.question: What is the recommended approach when responding to a misunderstanding during cross-examination?
questions.answer: Clarify the misunderstanding

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Two Truths and a Lie' warm-up activity?
choices: To demonstrate how questioning can reveal truth
To assess students' knowledge of current events
questions.answer: To demonstrate how questioning can reveal truth

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a key component of Lincoln-Douglas debate in the course overview?
questions.answer: Visual aids

questions.question: What is the recommended approach when asking questions during cross-examination?
choices: Use a combination of open-ended and closed questions
Ask as many questions as possible without listening to answers
Focus solely on attacking the opponent's character
questions.answer: Use a combination of open-ended and closed questions

questions.question: What is the purpose of an 'open-ended question' in cross-examination?
questions.answer: To gather more detailed information

questions.question: How should a debater respond when they don't know the answer to a question in cross-examination?
choices: Ignore the question and ask their own
Admit they don't know but explain their position
questions.answer: Admit they don't know but explain their position

questions.question: What is the primary goal of the homework assignment in the lesson plan?
choices: To analyze and learn from real debate cross-examinations
To write a full debate case
questions.answer: To analyze and learn from real debate cross-examinations

questions.question: Which of the following is a key consideration when adapting Lincoln-Douglas debate for Timor-Leste?
choices: Connecting values to Timorese cultural context
questions.answer: Connecting values to Timorese cultural context

questions.question: What is the recommended approach when an opponent gives a vague answer during cross-examination?
choices: Accept the answer and move on
questions.answer: Follow up to seek clarification

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a key skill developed through Lincoln-Douglas debate in the course overview?
questions.answer: Mathematical reasoning

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'redirecting to your strengths' when answering questions in cross-examination?
choices: To highlight the strongest aspects of your case
To extend the time of cross-examination
questions.answer: To highlight the strongest aspects of your case

questions.question: Which of the following is a recommended strategy for time management in Lincoln-Douglas debate?
choices: Using all available time for cross-examination
Allocating time effectively for different speech segments
questions.answer: Allocating time effectively for different speech segments

questions.question: What is the purpose of analyzing persuasive speeches by Timorese leaders in the course?
choices: To learn techniques for persuasive communication
questions.answer: To learn techniques for persuasive communication

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a component of an argument in the course overview?
questions.answer: Rebuttal

questions.question: What is the recommended approach for selecting criteria in Lincoln-Douglas debate?
choices: Use the same criteria for every debate
Select and justify criteria appropriate to the resolution
questions.answer: Select and justify criteria appropriate to the resolution

questions.question: Which of the following is a suggested practical experience in the course overview?
choices: Organizing a public debate on a local issue
Writing a research paper on debate theory
questions.answer: Organizing a public debate on a local issue

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'claim-warrant-impact' model in argumentation?
questions.answer: To structure logical arguments

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a type of refutation in the course overview?
questions.answer: Amplify

questions.question: What is the recommended approach for using evidence in Lincoln-Douglas debate?
choices: Incorporate various types of relevant evidence
questions.answer: Incorporate various types of relevant evidence

questions.question: Which of the following is emphasized as important for delivery in Lincoln-Douglas debate?
choices: Using vocal variety and appropriate body language
questions.answer: Using vocal variety and appropriate body language

questions.question: What is the purpose of studying the history of debate in democratic societies?
choices: To understand the role of debate in democracy
To practice pronunciation of difficult names
questions.answer: To understand the role of debate in democracy

questions.question: Which of the following is suggested as an additional resource in the course overview?
choices: Guest lectures from local community leaders
questions.answer: Guest lectures from local community leaders
